summary: Bored? Tired of being a noob? Maybe its time your dragonborn ascended to challenge the power of the divines themselves with the God Maker script!
descriptionHtml:
[About]
Why use GOD maker? Well, TGM requires that you need to active it every time you start your game. It also has no limits in certain areas such as carry weight and also doesn\'t give you all the perks, spells, or enchants (via dispell). This batch will do all of that and more. It gives you a tiny boost in every way possible.

This mod...
discovers every location that has not yet been discovered (but they are not unlocked, until you visit them, so you know which ones you have not been to yet)
increases player speed at an acceptable rate
increases player weapon speed at an acceptable rate
adds and unlocks every shout
takes away shout cooldown
gives 500 carry weight
maxes every skill
unlocks every perk
makes every spell more powerful
makes every spell cost nothing
unlocks every player-usable spell
gives you one of each type of enchantment for you to dispell
makes you immune to spells and disease
increases regen rates.

Feel free to modify it to the way you see fit.

[Install]
place the text file into the skyrim game directory.

typical install directory: 
64-bit: C:\\Program Files (x86)\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim
32 bit: C:\\Program Files\\Steam\\steamapps\\common\\skyrim

[How to use]
Once you have placed GOD.txt into the same directory as TESV.exe then you will need to go into the game. Once in-game you will need to hit the tilde key, which is a key on your keyboard that looks like this -> [~]. Once you hit that key, type in \"bat GOD\" and hit enter. You should see a bit of text popping up. You may then hit [~] again to close the console. TADA! If you followed instructions then all is as it should be. You may open up the text file and alter it to accommodate what you think god-status should be if you wanna be super excessive or maybe make it a little less overpowered.


[credits]
Myself
mmo-game.eu
All spells taken from: http://www.xboxmb.com/forum/103-elder-scrolls-series/89315-skyrim-how-make-use-batch-files-all-spells-perks-god.html
Any other data was taken out of the wiki :)
author: Korodic
